intro: Cracca candida var. obtusifolia, commonly known as the white cranesbill, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It features basal leaves that are broadly ovate to elliptic in shape, with a distinctive white or pale green coloration. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers arranged in dense, terminal clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and naturalized landscapes.
